explanation: lfs_remove_ — direct callee of lfs_remove; the rule violation cannot be ruled out without inspecting this function. lfs_fs_forceconsistency, lfs_dir_find, lfs_tag_id, lfs_tag_type3, lfs_dir_get, lfs_pair_fromle32, lfs_dir_fetch, lfs_fs_preporphans, lfs_dir_commit, lfs_gstate_hasorphans, lfs_fs_pred, lfs_dir_drop — all are direct callees of lfs_remove_ according to the static call graph and are therefore reachable from lfs_remove. Any of these may perform comparisons of path or filename data (particularly the lfs_dir_* functions), so they must be inspected for uses of memcmp comparing null-terminated strings. memcmp — the Standard Library function addressed by the MISRA rule; its uses (and the context of the arguments passed) must be located and examined to determine whether null-terminated strings are being compared.
